result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan R. Lindert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan R. Lindert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan R. Lindert was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

for Leave to File an Amended Information

Defendant Nathan R. Lindert in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Matter is resolved.  State files amended information.  Atty Raabe states recommendations.  State is in agreement/no request for restitution at this time.  Court wishes to review VIS prior to going any further.  Parties review VIS.  Atty Raabe enters NC plea to Ct 2.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Raabe makes statement.  DE makes statement.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  Dismissed
Ct 2:  NC
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk's Office
DNA sample to be provided
Entered in error - no waiver done - cannot erase due to reporting to DOJ DNAdatabank

Attorney Adam Raabe via telephone.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to dismiss.  DE opposes the motion.  Court dismisses counts 2 & 3 of the amended information.  Court denies the motion to dismiss.

Defendant Nathan R. Lindert in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Officer Keith Rosciszewski, sworn & testifies as to allegations in complaint.  Lake Delton Police Dept.  Attorney Middleton cross examines Officer Rosciszewski.  Attorney Middleton addresses report.  Officer reviews report from incident.  State objects.  Court overrules.  State redirect.  State moves for bind over.  Attorney Middleton objects to bind over, gives argument.  State addresses argument.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.

Defendant Nathan R. Lindert by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Nathan R. Lindert in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton explains reason for nonappearance.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet but has been advised of his right to counsel.  State agrees to reinstatement of prior bond.  Court admonishes DE and reinstates prior bond.  Bond conditions continue as previously ordered.  No PTC was set as DE said he wanted to get counsel.  Atty Middleton states DE will continue to waive time limits.  Court sets PTC and RD.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
